    • Method Detail

      • concatValueNodes

        public static ValueNode<?>[] concatValueNodes(ValueNode<?> node,
                                              ValueNode<?>... nodes)
        This is a static utility method for constructing the array of value nodes that is passed to the Node class on initialization of a subclass. If any node passed in is null, the method simply returns a new empty array, leaving the checking and exception throwing to you (the person writing a constructor).
        Parameters:
        node - A ValueNode to add to the returned array.
        nodes - ValueNode(s) to add to the returned array.
        Returns:
        An array of ValueNodes containing node and the contents of nodes unless either of them was/ contained null (in which case an empty array).

      • concatValueNodes

        public static ValueNode<?>[] concatValueNodes(ValueNode<?>[] nodeArray,
                                              ValueNode<?>... nodes)
        This is a static utility method for constructing the array of value nodes that is passed to the Node class on initialization of a subclass. If any node passed in is null, the method simply returns a new empty array, leaving the checking and exception throwing to you (the person writing a constructor).
        Parameters:
        nodeArray - A ValueNodes to add to the returned array.
        nodes - ValueNode(s) to add to the returned array.
        Returns:
        An array of ValueNodes containing the contents of nodeArray and nodes unless either of them was/ contained null (in which case an empty array).

      • valueNodesToArray

        public static ValueNode<?>[] valueNodesToArray(java.util.Collection<? extends ValueNode<?>> nodes)
        This is a static utility method for constructing the array of value nodes that is passed to the Node class on initialization of a subclass. If any node passed in is null or the collection is null, the method simply returns a new empty array, leaving the checking and exception throwing to you (the person writing a constructor).
        Parameters:
        nodes - A collection of nodes to convert into an array.
        Returns:
        An array containing the contents of nodes unless it or it's contents are null in which case a new empty array.

      • valueNodesMapToArray

        public static ValueNode<?>[] valueNodesMapToArray(java.util.Map<? extends java.lang.Object,? extends ValueNode<?>> nodes)
        This is a static utility method for constructing the array of value nodes that is passed to the Node class on initialization of a subclass. If any node passed in is null or the collection is null, the method simply returns a new empty array, leaving the checking and exception throwing to you (the person writing a constructor).
        Parameters:
        nodes - A map of containing ValueNodes as it's values to be converted to an array. THE KEYS ARE NOT CONVERTED!
        Returns:
        An array containing the contents of nodes unless it or it's contents are null in which case a new empty array.
